channel.title: 474 Models dumped into 317 cache, little help needed
channel.description:
Hi, I've been struggling for the past week, trying to get this to work right, I've dumped all 474 models into my cache, and I've been experiencing some problems; Items freeze client - fixed Items invisible - fixed Varrock missing - need help with
When I use tom's cache suite to replace obj.dat and obj.idx, the items are invisible, so I replace models_crc, and models_version, then they show, but Varrock, and some other places are either fully black, or just stays on "Loading... Please wait", until I teleport somewhere else. I've dumped a lot from other clients that have this feature (317 clients), and I do have the correct model header, but I just can't figure it out..
I've replaced index.dat in textures, but it says "Java heap space.." when it loads the textures, so i tried using highmem/lowmem, -Xmx256m > -Xmx2000m, nothing works there.
any help?

item.title: 474 Models dumped into 317 cache, little help needed
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

What do you mean? I’m not trying to delete the models, I’ve dumped them into the cache, I have it working there, just the map is messed up in Varrock. The models dump into the cache perfectly fine, the main_file_cache.dat grows, along with one of the idx files, main goes from 19mb to 23mb.

Read full topic
item.source: 474 Models dumped into 317 cache, little help needed

item.title: 474 Models dumped into 317 cache, little help needed
item.dc:creator: @Tylerholmes Tylerholmes
item.description:
@Tylerholmes wrote:

The command, ::dumpmodels
Is completely useless…It’s easier just to delete the model’s by hand.

Read full topic
item.source: 474 Models dumped into 317 cache, little help needed

item.title: 474 Models dumped into 317 cache, little help needed
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

::dumpmodels
I replaced both, I’m just saying when I add model_version only, it messes it all up, I’ve dumped all 3 from (and obj.dat, etc), from other clients, and it can’t be the models, since I’ve replaced my old client’s cache with it, and it all worked, with the exception of Varrock, thank you for the help though, most i’ve gotten in a while.

Read full topic
item.source: 474 Models dumped into 317 cache, little help needed

item.title: 474 Models dumped into 317 cache, little help needed
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

Vince:

All objects, models, and NPCs show, not trying to use any GFX, Maps, or Animations, it’s just when I update the model_version to 474 it messes up some places, even tried replacing most of my java files with some from clients with it all working, and it still didn’t show Varrock, I’m guessing it has to be something with my cache, but what?

you update the model_version model_crc, and model_index, not just one.

and you have to dump all 474 models into the cache, not just starting from 14396 or wherever the 317/377 model list stops.

If you have already done that im not quite sure, but like i said before, 1 bad model can make a map turn black or make it not load at all, regardless of any model indeces.

Read full topic
item.source: 474 Models dumped into 317 cache, little help needed

item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

All objects, models, and NPCs show, not trying to use any GFX, Maps, or Animations, it’s just when I update the model_version to 474 it messes up some places, even tried replacing most of my java files with some from clients with it all working, and it still didn’t show Varrock, I’m guessing it has to be something with my cache, but what?

Read full topic
item.source: 474 Models dumped into 317 cache, little help needed

item.title: 474 Models dumped into 317 cache, little help needed
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

Vince:

The client loads, I can dump all of the objects/npcs/items, no problem, I should say Varrock loads objects, just doesn’t load textures, I guess? Such as the castle, the ground, the houses(stores), etc.

not quite, the object can load fine, but the model it tries to load can be a newer header model, yes you said you have the ‘new’ header, but some models still dont work. Also, you are loading 317 varrock arent you? If youre trying to load a higher revision map you need to disable crc checking.

Read full topic
item.source: 474 Models dumped into 317 cache, little help needed

its probably because a nulled object or model is preventing the client from loading.
